evidence: The magnitude of this vector is equal to the length of a times the length of b times the sine of the angle between them.
triples.o: magnitude equal to the length of a times the length of b times the sine of the angle between them

evidence: The cross product gives us an orthogonal vector that carries both magnitude and direction.
Cross products appear naturally when we describe torques, angular momentum, and precession, making them essential to understanding the behavior of magnetic moments in an external field.
